title: 'Baffling' decision to carry on with no-deal Brexit motorway plan causes motorist misery
text:
Motorists endured misery on Monday after one half of a motorway was turned into a “lorry park” to test it for no deal Brexit preparedness — even though Britain is no longer leaving the EU on Oct 31.

Highways England introduced Operation Brock on the M20 in Kent at 6am, just three and a half hours before Brussels confirmed it was extending Article 50 until the end of January.

It led to long tailbacks on the motorway, which was made worse by a crash which blocked part of the carriageway.

Drivers vented their fury on Twitter branding Highways England and the Department for Transport “Muppets” for presiding over the “chaos” which could now take days to reverse.

description: Motorists endured misery on Monday after one half of a motorway was turned into a “lorry park” to test it for no deal Brexit preparedness — even though Britain is no longer leaving the EU on Oct 31.
